description.narrative:
AREU är en oberoende afgansk forskningsorganisation med huvudsyfte att informera och påverka politik och praxis genom att bedriva högkvalitativ, policyrelevant forskning och att aktivt delge olika intressenter som media, regering och parlament, nationella organisationer, samt det civila samhällets organisationer. Man bedriver forskning, i huvudsak, inom områdena jämställdhet, förvaltning av naturresurser och säkra försörjningskällor, styrning och ekonomi samt den sociala sektorn.
Vidare, så arbetar också AREU på att uppmuntra studenter och andra forskare att utnyttja AREUs arbete och deras omfattande bibliotek. Detta för att öka allmänhetens medvetenhet om sin forskning och institutionen som helhet, likasom att bidra mer allmänt till en miljö av ömsesidig ansvarighet genom att skapa möjligheter för analys, reflektion, och debatt.
Huvudsyftet med AREUs forskning är att lyfta inhemska prioriteringar och förbättra villkoren för gemene man. Detta ligger i linje med den svenska "Resultatstrategi för Sveriges internationella bistånd i Afghanistan 2014-2019", och särskilt med fokus på stöd till den egna förmågan (Empowerment) - för att flera kvinnor och män ska delta i stärkta demokratiska processer.
AREU har fått stöd från Sverige sedan 2004, och Sida har fått årlig rapportering v g AREU genomförda forskning, och publicerade rapporter. Då AREU bedriver en verksamhet där man svårligen kan påvisa resultat i ett kortare perspektiv, gjorde Sida en utvärdering av AREUs verksamhet och genomslag under 2013. Utvärderingen gav vid handen att AREUs forskning är relevant för de intressenter men särskild riktar sig till, man även för befolkningen i allmänhet.
AREU har inkommit med en ansökan på tre år (2016-2018) med en summa på SEK 15 000 000 totalt.

Support to AREU, an independent Afghan research organization with the main purpose to inform and influence policy and practice through policy relevant research within the areas gender equality, management of natural resources, governance and economics, and the social sector.

The overall intended outcome of AREU's Strategic Plan 2016-2018 programme is to provide solid, evidence-based research, conducted with the highest ethical and quality-controlled standards, to stimulate public discourse and policy decisions that are rooted in the reality of Afghanistan. Furthermore, AREU aims to ensure the early by-in of the research and to pave the way for better cooperation and uptake of the research among the public and policy-makers. This has entailed a multi-pronged outreach approach targeting key decision makers within the Afghan government on both central and local level, the civil society organisations, as well as influential thinkers, public intellectuals and public discourse within the country, and in the end the Afghan people. A mode of working when producing their strategy plan for the period 2016-2018 has been inclusive and interacting with the stakeholders in conducting roundtables with Members of Parliament, provincial and local governing entities, the civil society organisations, international stakeholders and having open discussions on different topics. The prioritized areas of research for the period of 2016-2018 have been defined as Gender, Natural Resource Management and Sustainable Livelihoods, Political Economy and Governance, Constitutional Law, and Social Sector and Social Protection.

description.narrative: AREU has produced high quality research reports, working papers, policy notes and articles within the areas of Gender, Natural Resource Management and Sustainable Livelihoods, Political Economy and Governance, Constitutional Law, and Social Sector and Social Protection. AREU has further worked actively to promote public discussion within their areas of research through different media events, round table discussions, press briefings, as well as through social media outreach. The research publications and AREU’s work to disseminate the findings to both senior decision-makers and a wider public audience serves as the foundation of AREU's strive to nurture evidence based decision-making. AREU has been recognized internationally for its research achievements on several occasions. In 2017 AREU placed fifth in a ranking of the top 65 think tanks in Central Asia as part of the “2017 Global Go To Think Tank Index Report”. In addition, AREU was named 26th out of 145 global organizations in the Best Independent Think Tanks category in the same index. Another major highlight was the Prospect Magazine's Think Tank Awards ceremony 2018. Prospect Magazine awards think tanks in different thematic categories and geographic categories (UK, Europe, North America, International). AREU was awarded the top international think tank in the Social Policy category, and was further among the shortlisted think tanks in the Environment and Energy category. As an example of the a result 2016 was the publication of the findings from theresearch project "Afghan Masculinities and its Impact on Gender Equality in Afghanistan".The overall purpose of the research was to achieve an in-depth understanding of variousnotions regarding manhood in Afghanistan and how they contribute to gender inequality. The publication was designed to inform both policy and practice in how to address gender inequalities vis-à-vis notions of masculinities in Afghanistan. Besides from producing evidence-based research reports, AREU is working on fostering a culture of research in Afghanistan. One of the ways of achieving this is through partnerships with different Afghan entities – Afghan universities, Government Institutions, International organisations. For example, AREU managed to reach all 34 provinces of Afghanistan through a partnership with Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) with a project that served to identify developmental and financial gaps in achieving SDGs at the local level. Furthermore, AREU has an extensive library that has been appreciated by students and scholars alike.
